Summary Hoa is a Technical Project Manager at Intel Corporation, leading a strategic program conducting collaborative research in several technical disciplines.  
 
Hoa is taking his third sabbatical after twenty-one year of service with the company - an inflection point in his professional career, when new challenges and opportunities are sought to rejuvenate the passion for excellencies and services.  
 
Hoa is a strategic thinker and planner; an adept technologist who apprehends technology barriers in many areas at different phases of semiconductor design and manufacturing, then translate them into achievable objectives for innovation. Hoa is an effective communicator, interfacing with cross-team technologists in many areas while driving contribution from stakeholders in and outside of the company- communicate goals, progress, and roadblocks, influence decisions, persuade of changes, and drive towards fruitful results. Through solid engineering education, work experience and years of continuing education, Hoa grows expertise in system architecture, micro-architecture, verification, CAD tools, manufacturing test, and emerging trends such as hardware security for IoT, device driver synthesis and NVM enabling.  
 
Hoa is also an authorized expert in handling Intellectual Property (IP) to avoid costly legal issues for the company - protection, compliance and licensing negotiation. Hoa develops cost effective, win-win collaboration models with institutions to fuel strategic innovation, and is recognized as the go-to person for “hiring” scholars in the company. 
 
Hoa reviews proposals and advises for several industry consortium groups and government agencies. He served as Chair/Vice-Chair for several semiconductor consortia, a member of the Technical Advisory Board for the Semiconductor Research Corporation since 2000, and frequently served in relevant semiconductor industry panels. Experience Technical Project Manager Intel Corporation January 2000  – Present (15 years 8 months) Folsom, CA I am a technical project manager at Intel Corporation, leading a path-finding, multi-disciplinary technical program. The program is mission-ed with nurturing solutions for some of the most challenging, long term and high impact technical barriers in various phases of product development – those that exceed routine engineering effort, and require a collaborative partnership between in house expertise and industry, institution and government resources, under rigorous IP agreements and regulation compliance.

Summary Deb is an accomplished and energetic technical leader with a passion for innovation and collaboration with 6+ years of work experience in Intel. Her key areas of expertise include technical project management, new product introductions, product & process development (tooling, design and integration roles), operation excellence (LEAN initiatives) and supplier and vendor management. She has a proven track record of leading early engagement activities across multi- cross-functional teams (~15 people) positioned in 5 global inter-continental locations through collaboration, and teamwork. This has enabled her team to execute and ensure hardware design readiness (schedule, quality & cost of testing) for Intel’s two flagship products from two different technologies, delivered at reduced costs, enhanced quality and a more effective design and manufacturing schedule.  
 
Deb’s career experience has been a healthy mix of working together as part of a team (project management, supply chain management and integration job roles) and individual contribution (design, module and tooling development job roles). Deb’s proven track record in developing and executing strategic design processes and best known methodologies for process improvement has been commendable. She has also successfully mentored and trained a handful of engineers across four global locations on design and integration related activities of the test hardware. 
 Summary Deb is an accomplished and energetic technical leader with a passion for innovation and collaboration with 6+ years of work experience in Intel. Summary Bret has an extensive information systems background, with over 20 years of industry experience as a project manager, business analyst, data analyst, and developer. Since joining Windsor, Bret has served as a project manager and lead analyst for many medium and large-scale projects for government environmental agencies from over 20 states and the EPA, developing information systems for Air, Waste, Water, and Natural Resources environmental programs, as well as multiple cross-program systems. 
 
Prior to Windsor, Bret was employed for 15 years working for Intel’s prestigious analytical and Q&R (quality and reliability) labs, providing valuable information systems to the microprocessor research and development division. During his time at Intel, Bret served as a project manager, business analyst, data analyst, lead developer, and group manager. 
 
Bret brings information systems experience in both web and client-server based applications, many of which include secure public-facing web-based or mobile data collection systems. Bret has demonstrated a propensity for learning new skills, and helps create a culture that supports and rewards continuous learning, risk taking, and leveraging emerging trends. 
 
Specialties: Project management, meeting facilitation, team leadership, stakeholder management, requirements gathering and analysis, application design, database modeling and development, test coordination, and training. Summary I am a program manager and technologist at Intel. I began working at Intel in 1996 supporting Internet applications and compression algorithms in the Intel Architecture Lab I then spent ten years managing various enterprise-level software implementations supporting the Intel software developer community, Intel Health, and Intel Customer Support. After a two year stint working with a new business incubation team, I shifted gears to support a series of software scaling and firmware configuration initiatives. 
 
I balance a data-driven decision making discipline with thoughtful diplomacy delivered with a dose of subtle humor. While I have mastered the nuts and bolts of project initiation, planning, execution, and control, my core strength is my ability to listen attentively, adapt and resolve problems without becoming emotionally entangled in the moment. I strive to create project environments where team members are both empowered to perform and appreciated for the results they achieve. After all, project management is all about the people.  
 
I am a PMP-credentialed Project Manager specializing in globally distributed, organizationally complex, software and product development projects.  
 
I crave innovation and like to spend time fiddling with microcontrollers and other simple yet useful electronic gadgets. I contribute to crowd-sourced projects at a level that will likely require intervention at some point. :-) I wear a smart watch and fitness tracker and I am always on the lookout for that next high-utility wearable device promising to make life better, longer, easier… 
 
I am an Intel social media practitioner, pragmatic futurist, and crypto-currency & micro-lending hobbyist. I enjoy soccer, running and hiking...and at the end of the day, I often make time to enjoy a quality northwest craft-brewed ale.
